title: How to Make Chocolate Ice Cubes

steps.headline: Prepare the dark chocolate.
steps.description: Use a sharp knife to cut the chocolate into fine pieces. Use a heat-proof bowl to store them and set aside.

steps.headline: Create the mixture.
steps.description: Add the other ingredients (water, milk, instant coffee, cocoa powder, and sugar) into a large saucepan. Allow everything to come to a boil over medium heat.

steps.headline: Pour the mixture over the chocolate.
steps.description: Allow the chocolate to melt, about five minutes, before thoroughly combining everything together.

steps.headline: Pour the mixture into an ice cube tray.
steps.description: Distribute even amounts into each hole in the tray for the best results.

steps.headline: Freeze the chocolate until hardened thoroughly.
Serve the ice cubes.
steps.description: Drop and enjoy them in cold drinks that would accompany chocolate, such as vanilla shakes or regular milk.

text: Prepare the dark chocolate. Use a sharp knife to cut the chocolate into fine pieces. Use a heat-proof bowl to store them and set aside. Create the mixture. Add the other ingredients (water, milk, instant coffee, cocoa powder, and sugar) into a large saucepan. Allow everything to come to a boil over medium heat. Pour the mixture over the chocolate. Allow the chocolate to melt, about five minutes, before thoroughly combining everything together. Pour the mixture into an ice cube tray. Distribute even amounts into each hole in the tray for the best results. Freeze the chocolate until hardened thoroughly.  Serve the ice cubes. Drop and enjoy them in cold drinks that would accompany chocolate, such as vanilla shakes or regular milk.
